relation: The type of activity, as one of the following values: Running, Cycling, Mountain Biking, Walking, Hiking, Downhill Skiing, Cross-Country Skiing, Snowboarding, Skating, Swimming, Wheelchair, Rowing, Elliptical, Other
The starting time for the activity (e.g., Sat, 1 Jan 2011 00:00:00)
The UTC offset of the timezone for the activity (if available)
The total distance for the activity, in meters
The duration of the activity, in seconds
The total calories burned (omitted if not available)
The name of the application that last modified this activity
The mode by which this activity was originally entered, as one of the following values: API, Web
The mode by which this activity was originally tracked, as one of the following values: indoor, outdoor
Whether a path exists for this activity
The URI of the detailed information for the past activity
textBeforeTable: Because a user’s activity feed can grow very large, feeds are divided into pages. Each page contains links to the previous and next pages as well as the total number of activities across all pages. Each page of a user’s activity feed has the following structure: Feed Note: The term “fitness activity” is historical. With the addition of strength training activities, fitness activities will likely be renamed “cardio activities.” Any such change will retain backwards compatibility with existing applications. Fitness activities appear in a user’s fitness feed on the Runkeeper website. Fitness activities take one of several forms, depending upon whether they reflect past events, newly-completed events, or in-progress events (“live activities”). Fitness activities are grouped in reverse chronological order in a fitness activity feed. textAfterTable: Editable uri String The URI for this activity N userID Integer The unique ID of the user for the activity N type String The type of activity, as one of the following values: Running , Cycling , Mountain Biking , Walking , Hiking , Downhill Skiing , Cross-Country Skiing , Snowboarding , Skating , Swimming , Wheelchair , Rowing , Elliptical , Other , Yoga , Pilates , CrossFit , Spinning , Zumba , Barre , Group Workout , Dance , Bootcamp , Boxing / MMA , Meditation , Strength Training , Circuit Training , Core Strengthening , Arc Trainer , Stairmaster / Stepwell , Sports , Nordic Walking Y secondary_type String The secondary type of the activity, as a free-form string (max. 64 characters). This field is used only if the type field is Other." Y equipment String The equipment used to complete this activity, as one of the following values: None, Treadmill, Stationary Bike, Elliptical, Row Machine. (Optional; if not specified, None is assumed.)
